content.body: jruderman: thanks for pointing that one out
I see http://bugs.ecmascript.org/report/1
trying to remember what's different between 3.1 and Harmony
http://wiki.ecmascript.org/doku.php?id=es3.1:es3.1_proposal_working_draft
great that they don't publish the draft in HTML, but they do provide it in MS Word format in addition to PDF. way to go the extra mile
MikeSmith: HTML is dead, compared to MS Word, HTML is lame
Only old people use HTML
heh
Real users need entiprise features like Wordart
I prefer OpenOffice format, because using the OpenOffice applications is great torture test of the CPU and memory resources of my machine
heh
MikeSmith: So, basically, I'm just trying to do a dissertation as controversial as possible :)
gsnedders: reading Nabakov is great cure for sleeplessness
MikeSmith: I am, however, starting to run out of (English) Nabokov I haven't yet read :)
I recommend abandoning him completely and reading all of Flann O'Brien instead
MikeSmith: That wouldn't bode well for my English dissertation, though
fuck it, prove to them that you are a risk-taker and an original
and if they don't like that, burn the school down
Oh, I think my English teacher would let me
that fallback strategy always worked well for me
has already completely changed his computing project
is now working on Anolis in a slight guise
read Camus instead :)
my sister found me a first english edition of The Plague for christmas, it really made my day
Ah

gsnedders: English teachers are easy to manipulate, because their grasp of reason and logic is usually pretty shakey. Most of them did really poorly at math and science, which is why they ended up becoming English teachers
I got a couple of non-fiction books from my mother, and The Time Traveller's Wife from my sister
(which I have had several friends recommend to me)
ay, it's a good book
(I could make an interesting observation about their choice of recommending that book to me with what they know about me, but this is publicly logged :))
(hint: It relates to the title character's first name)
ok finally completed gta iv
Hixie: Did I ever say that myself and BenMillard found the Spiderman walk-through level hard?
Hixie: Mainly because we were laughing so much we didn't actually know what we were meant to do.
"PS: what we probably need now is more implementation of current W3C Reccomandations like XForms 1.0, instead of running behind the latest HTML5 Editor's Drafts)"
thinks Giovanni missed the reason the WHATWG was initiated
annevk: hehe
1st of all, I wish everyone an abundance of Christmas blessings.
It is easy to tell the first occurrence of a technical term from the following ones.
That is what the DFN element is for.
Alex wanted to say that it should be possible to attach other script engines to existing HTML documents.
But that is already supported.
yecril71, some context in the form of quotes or URLs would help when you place one of your comments in IRC
I often have a hard time telling what you're on about
I am trying to formulate my remarks so that they are context-free.
Arenï¿½t they?
The context would be visible if I were allowed to use e-mail reply function.
But I have been asked not to do this because my remarks are considered unconstructive.

foo

bar

magic
How can I get the magic to be displayed just after the "bar", on the same line?
gsnedders, use css to make the blockquote an inline-block
"display:inline-block;" should do it
erlehmann: Does that stop margins from folders?
what are "folders" ?
*folding
inline-block behaves like an "inline replaced element", AFAIK
but i think margin folding stops only when using floats, wasn't it that ? i am unsure.
It appears to stop folding in Saf
(It's no issue, because I shouldn't really have a margin on the blockquote anyway)
what is "saf" ?
Safari
ah
Hmmâ¦
q for something someone said is fine (e.g., <q>I am</q>, he said), yet isn't fine in fiction, as you aren't actually quoting anyone arguably.
Hixie: ayt?
ap: Dec 27 is Hixie's b-day (according to what he said in irc a day or two ago), so in 10 minutes for you.... :)
cool, if he was here, I could perhaps be the first to congratulate :-)
Hixie: Happy One-Year-To-Doomage!
anyone here at 25c3 ?
Happy Birthday Hixie
